intro: Chytranthus longiracemosus, commonly known as the long-branch chytranthus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically arranged in racemes, giving it a branched appearance. It is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
